explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point:56.6degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 385mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat dermal study reported the LC50 value of >2.4mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of slight effects with the maximum Draize score of ca. 1.0, which were fully recovered within 4 days, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2001)). The substance is thus considered non-irritating.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of slight effects with the maximum Draize score of ca. 1.0, which resolved within 24 hours, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)). The substance is thus considered non-irritating.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro studies (reverse mutation tests and mouse lymphoma tests) and mouse in vivo micronucleus tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990, 2003)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development observed in mouse 2-generation reproduction studies and rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In single dose toxicity studies in animals, signs and symptoms of toxicity including "sedation," "hyperventilation," "piloerection," "anemic eyeball," "salivation," and "nasal secretion" were observed (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)). However, classification is not possible since no target organs were identified from these findings and the doses at which these effects were observed are not given.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=11ppb of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=212(Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN()), it was classified into Category 1.
